conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the system during rotation.
Key points are forces exerted by balls on the rod and by the rod on the balls.
Ball A exerts no force on the rod at the highest point, so force exerted by ball A is zero.
Ball B exerts no force on the rod at the highest point.
Rod is rotating in a vertical plane, balls are fixed at ends.
Force exerted by rod on ball A is centripetal force \( F_c = \frac{mv_A^2}{r} \).
Force exerted by rod on ball B is centripetal force \( F_c = \frac{mv_B^2}{r} \).
Velocity of ball A is zero at the highest point, \( v_A = 0 \).
Using centripetal force formula, force on ball A is \( F_c = \frac{mv_A^2}{r} = 0 \).
Using centripetal force formula, force on ball B is \( F_c = \frac{mv_B^2}{r} = 0 \).
Force exerted by ball B on the rod is zero.
